title: Spacecom plots maritime expansion after netting first customer
summary: Israeli satellite operator Spacecom is adjusting its business to serve maritime customers as the market shows signs of recovering from the pandemic.

title: India hit by more suspected space debris
summary: Indian authorities are examining several pieces of suspected space debris that fell into rural western India on May 12, with the timing of the incident suggesting they could be parts of a Chinese rocket that reentered the atmosphere that day.

title: U.S. Space Force sees future demand for surveillance beyond Earth orbit
summary: Space Force Lt. Gen. Whiting said the U.S. military will likely have to pay more attention to what’s happening in cislunar space

title: Former NASA leaders praise Boeing’s willingness to risk commercial crew
summary: "I think if they look back on it, they wouldn't do it again."

title: Chinese satellite propulsion startup secures funding as country’s constellation projects grow
summary: A Chinese satellite electric propulsion company has secured multi-million yuan angel round financing amid a proliferation of Chinese constellation plans.

title: SpaceX launches two Starlink missions in 24 hours
summary: Two SpaceX Falcon 9 rockets have completed back-to-back Starlink launches less than 24 hours apart, successfully delivering 106 Starlink satellites to low...

title: Launcher announces customers for first Orbiter space tug mission
summary: Launch vehicle and in-space transportation services company Launcher has filled the manifest for the first flight of its space tug later this year with a mix of commercial and academic payloads.

title: Redwire warns of volatility in commercial space markets
summary: Space technology company Redwire said that while it still sees the commercial sector as its biggest prospect for long-term growth, volatility among its customers may cause delays.

title: SpaceX launches Starlink 4-15 mission, expands booster fleet
summary:
SpaceX is launched its twentieth Falcon 9 rocket of the year with a batch of Starlink satellites to Low Earth Orbit (LEO) on the Starlink Group 4-15 mission. Liftoff occurred on Saturday, May 14 at 4:40:50pm EDT (20:40:50 UTC) from Space Launch Complex 40 (SLC-40) at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station (CCSFS) in Florida.

The Falcon 9 for this mission was of special interest as it uses a new booster, B1073-1, something not seen until now on a Starlink mission.

title: Air Force looking at next steps on Space Command basing decision
summary: “We're all hoping to move forward with a final decision as quickly as we can," Air Force Secretary Frank Kendall said regarding the relocation of U.S. Space Command
